abstract: The oil company’s chairman said Tony Hayward, the chief executive, would step away from daily operations in BP’s enormous effort to control the oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico.
snippet: The oil company’s chairman said Tony Hayward, the chief executive, would step away from daily operations in BP’s enormous effort to control the oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico.
lead_paragraph: A day after Tony Hayward, the chief executive of BP, was pummeled by members of a House committee over the company’s role in the disastrous oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico, the chairman of the company said in an interview that Mr. Hayward would step away from daily involvement in BP’s enormous response efforts in the gulf, The New York Times’s Liz Robbins reports.

headline.main: Shake-Up at BP as Hayward Steps Back From Spill
